The particle is negatively charged with mass m and charge q. It is shot into point S and moves along the central line SO.
The magnetic field is uniform with strength B and directed perpendicularly to the plane. The electric field acts between the metal plates.
The particle's motion is influenced by both the electric and magnetic forces. The magnetic force (F_B) is perpendicular to both the velocity of the particle and the magnetic field.
Since the particle just fails to exit the magnetic field at cd, the magnetic force must balance the electric force (F_E) when the particle is at C.
The magnetic force is given by F_B = qvB, where v is the velocity of the particle.
The particle travels from S to C in time t. The distance SC is equal to the side length of the square, which is 2L.
The equation of motion under the magnetic force is qvBt = m(v - v₀), where v₀ is the initial velocity.
Since the particle just fails to exit, v = 0 when the particle is at C. Thus, qvBt = m(v - v₀).
Solving for v₀ gives v₀ = qBt/m.
Substitute t = 2L/v₀ into the equation: qB(2L/v₀) = m(v₀ - v₀).
Solve the equation to find v₀ = √(2qLB/m).
